intro: Hieracium amblylopum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance, and its flowers are usually yellow with a central disc. Hieracium amblylopum is often found in high-altitude areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
